subject: Re: [junit] Eclipse - JUnit Configuration?
msgSnippet: ... Umm ... in a sense, 127.0.0.1 is EVERY development PC s IP : that s why they call it localhost. ... Why? Note that you are telling ZoneAlarm to get
messageBody:
On Mon, 2004-04-26 at 18:48, Clark I Anderson wrote:
>> IPConfig results: 127.0.0.1 is not the development PC's IP.

Umm ... in a sense, 127.0.0.1 is EVERY "development PC's IP": that's
why they call it "localhost."

>> I start from the menu with: Run/Run As /JUnit Test I can ping
>> 127.0.0.1; but ZoneAlarm is set to Ask permission for access any
>> port at that IP.

Why? Note that you are telling ZoneAlarm to get permission to talk to
yourself :-) IMHO you are misconfigured.

>> With ZoneAlarm, I tried approving access to 127.0.0.1:????? and The
>> test program ran achieving the 'green bar'.

Jason Rogers Tue Apr 27, 2004 4:58 am
> unless you have some really good reason to not allow connections to
> localhost just use the plugin.

And "unless you have some really good reason to not allow connections
to localhost," allow connections to localhost.
